query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
1 Buio d’inferno e di notte privata 2 d’ogne pianeto, sotto pover cielo, 3 quant’ esser può di nuvol tenebrata,
query.error: **English:** 1 Darkness of hell and of night deprived 2 of every planet, under a poor sky, 3 as much as can be darkened by clouds,
query.result: 1 Helledæġnung and nihtes genumen 2 ælces tungles, under heolþrum heofonum, 3 swa micel swa mæg niht beon niwolbeorht,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
4 non fece al viso mio sì grosso velo 5 come quel fummo ch’ivi ci coperse, 6 né a sentir di così aspro pelo,
query.error: **English:** 4 did not make a veil so thick to my face 5 as that smoke which covered us there, 6 nor to the feeling of such harsh texture,
query.result: 4 ne geworhte minre gesyhðe swa þicce wafels 5 swa se smēoc ðe ðær us beþeahte, 6 ne on geþylde swa heardes hæres,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
7 che l’occhio stare aperto non sofferse; 8 onde la scorta mia saputa e fida 9 mi s’accostò e l’omero m’offerse.
query.error: **English:** 7 that the eye could not bear to stay open; 8 whereupon my wise and faithful guide 9 approached me and offered me his shoulder.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
10 Sì come cieco va dietro a sua guida 11 per non smarrirsi e per non dar di cozzo 12 in cosa che ’l molesti, o forse ancida,
query.error: **English:** 10 Just as a blind man follows his guide 11 so as not to lose his way and not to bump into 12 something that might hurt him, or even kill him,
query.result: 10 Swa swa blind man gæð æfter his latteow, 11 ðæt he ne losige and ne hrine to 12 ðing ðe hine derige, oððe ðeah ofslea,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
13 m’andava io per l’aere amaro e sozzo, 14 ascoltando il mio duca che diceva 15 pur: «Guarda che da me tu non sia mozzo».
query.error: **English:** 13 so I went through the bitter and foul air, 14 listening to my guide who kept saying: 15 "Be careful not to get separated from me."
query.result: 13 ic eode ða ðurh ðone dimme wudu, 14 hlyste minum latteow ðe ðus cwæð: 15 "Loca nu ðæt ðu fram me ne losige."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
16 Io sentia voci, e ciascuna pareva 17 pregar per pace e per misericordia 18 l’Agnel di Dio che le peccata leva.
query.error: **English:** 16 I heard voices, and each one seemed 17 to pray for peace and for mercy 18 to the Lamb of God who takes away sins.
query.result: 16 Ic ðær hlynsode stefna, and ða æghwylc 17 ðuhte ðæt hit bæde frið and miltse 18 ðæs Godes Lamb ðe ða synna afyligeð.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
19 Pur ‘Agnus Dei’ eran le loro essordia; 20 una parola in tutte era e un modo, 21 sì che parea tra esse ogne concordia.
query.error: **English:** 19 Their opening words were always "Agnus Dei"; 20 they all spoke the same word and in the same manner, 21 so that there seemed to be perfect harmony among them.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
22 «Quei sono spirti, maestro, ch’i’ odo?», 23 diss’ io. Ed elli a me: «Tu vero apprendi, 24 e d’iracundia van solvendo il nodo».
query.error: **English:** 22 "Those are spirits, master, that I hear?" 23 I said. And he to me: "You truly perceive, 24 and from anger they are untying the knot."
query.result: 22 "Þa sindon gasta, lareow, ðe ic gehyre?" 23 cwæð ic. And he to me: "Þu soð gecnawest, 24 and of irre þa sindon unbindende ðone cnotta."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
25 «Or tu chi se’ che ’l nostro fummo fendi, 26 e di noi parli pur come se tue 27 partissi ancor lo tempo per calendi?».
query.error: **English:** 25 "Now who are you who cleaves our smoke, 26 and speak of us as if you 27 still measured time by calendars?"
query.result: 25 "Hwæt ðu eart ðe ðurh ðeos dreorighleoð 26 ðurh ðisne dimme reced ridan woldest, 27 and ðurh ðas hatan heolstra?"

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
28 Così per una voce detto fue; 29 onde ’l maestro mio disse: «Rispondi, 30 e domanda se quinci si va sùe».
query.error: **English:** 28 Thus it was said by a voice; 29 whereupon my master said: "Answer, 30 and ask if one goes up from here."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
31 E io: «O creatura che ti mondi 32 per tornar bella a colui che ti fece, 33 maraviglia udirai, se mi secondi».
query.error: **English:** 31 And I: "O creature who cleanses yourself 32 to return beautiful to the one who made you, 33 you will hear a marvel, if you follow me."
query.result: 31 And ic: "Eala ðu gesceaft ðe ðe selfne clænsast 32 ðurh ðæt ðu miht ðinum Scyppende ðe geworhte 33 wlitig eft geweorðan, ðu wundor gehyrst,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
34 «Io ti seguiterò quanto mi lece», 35 rispuose; «e se veder fummo non lascia, 36 l’udir ci terrà giunti in quella vece».
query.error: **English:** 34 "I will follow you as far as I am allowed," 35 he replied; "and if smoke prevents us from seeing, 36 hearing will keep us joined instead."
query.result: 34 "Ic ðe folgie swa hwider swa me ðin lufu læt," 35 he ða cwæð; "and gif ðe smoc ne let, 36 ðonne mæg ðin hlyst ðær gehyran hwæt ðu gesecgan ne miht."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
37 Allora incominciai: «Con quella fascia 38 che la morte dissolve men vo suso, 39 e venni qui per l’infernale ambascia.
query.error: **English:** 37 Then I began: "With that sash 38 which death loosens, I wish to go up, 39 and I came here through the infernal anguish."
query.result: 37 Þa ic ongan ðus: "Þurh ðone fætels 38 ðone deað ofslæð, ic wille uppan stigan, 39 and ic com her ðurh ða hellewitu."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
40 E se Dio m’ha in sua grazia rinchiuso, 41 tanto che vuol ch’i’ veggia la sua corte 42 per modo tutto fuor del moderno uso,
query.error: **English:** 40 And if God has enclosed me in His grace, 41 so that He wills that I see His court 42 in a manner completely outside of modern custom,
query.result: 40 And gif God me hæfð on his gife belocen, 41 swa ðæt he wile ðæt ic his rice geseo, 42 on ðæs wisan ðe nis on worulde gewunelic,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
43 non mi celar chi fosti anzi la morte, 44 ma dilmi, e dimmi s’i’ vo bene al varco; 45 e tue parole fier le nostre scorte».
query.error: **English:** 43 do not hide from me who you were before death, 44 but tell me, and tell me if I am going well toward the passage; 45 and your words will be our guides.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
46 «Lombardo fui, e fu’ chiamato Marco; 47 del mondo seppi, e quel valore amai 48 al quale ha or ciascun disteso l’arco.
query.error: **English:** 46 I was a Lombard, and I was called Marco; 47 I knew the world, and I loved that worth 48 to which everyone now has bent his bow.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
49 Per montar sù dirittamente vai». 50 Così rispuose, e soggiunse: «I’ ti prego 51 che per me prieghi quando sù sarai».
query.error: **English:** 49 To climb up straight, go that way." 50 Thus he answered, and added: "I beg you 51 to pray for me when you are up there."
query.result: 49 To climben up rihte gæð ðone weg." 50 Swa he andswarode and sæde me: "Ic bidde ðe, 51 ðæt ðu for me bidde ðonne ðu beo ðær uppe."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
52 E io a lui: «Per fede mi ti lego 53 di far ciò che mi chiedi; ma io scoppio 54 dentro ad un dubbio, s’io non me ne spiego.
query.error: **English:** 52 And I to him: "I bind myself to you by faith 53 to do what you ask of me; but I burst 54 within with a doubt, if I do not explain myself.
query.result: 52 And ic to him: "Þurh treowe ic me to ðe fæste 53 ðæt ic ðæt gefremme ðæt ðu me bebeodest; ac ic bærne 54 innan me sylfne anan ðing, gif ic hit ne asmeage.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
55 Prima era scempio, e ora è fatto doppio 56 ne la sentenza tua, che mi fa certo 57 qui, e altrove, quello ov’ io l’accoppio.
query.error: **English:** 55 Before it was simple, and now it has become double 56 in your judgment, which assures me 57 here and elsewhere of that to which I join it.
query.result: 55 Ǣr wæs ânfeald, and nu is geworden twifeald 56 on ðinum dôme, ðe me dóð gewisse 57 her and elles hwar ðæs ðe ic hit gecnýtte.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
58 Lo mondo è ben così tutto diserto 59 d’ogne virtute, come tu mi sone, 60 e di malizia gravido e coverto;
query.error: **English:** 58 The world is indeed so deserted 59 of every virtue, as you seem to tell me, 60 and pregnant and covered with wickedness;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
61 ma priego che m’addite la cagione, 62 sì ch’i’ la veggia e ch’i’ la mostri altrui; 63 ché nel cielo uno, e un qua giù la pone».
query.error: **English:** 61 but I pray that you point out the cause to me, 62 so that I may see it and show it to others; 63 for one places it in heaven, and another here below.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
64 Alto sospir, che duolo strinse in «uhi!», 65 mise fuor prima; e poi cominciò: «Frate, 66 lo mondo è cieco, e tu vien ben da lui.
query.error: **English:** 64 A heavy sigh, which grief wrung out into "Alas!", 65 he uttered first; and then began: "Brother, 66 the world is blind, and you come straight from it.
query.result: 64 Heortan sorge, ðe him on innan swealg, 65 ærorst ut forð, and ða word cwæð: "Broðor min, 66 blind is ðeos world, and ðu of hire cymst."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
67 Voi che vivete ogne cagion recate 68 pur suso al cielo, pur come se tutto 69 movesse seco di necessitate.
query.error: **English:** 67 You who attribute every cause 68 up there to heaven, as if everything 69 moved with it out of necessity.
query.result: 67 Ge ðe on life ealle gesceafta 68 settað on heofonas, swa swa hi sylfe 69 mid ðære sunnan suðeweardne weg

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
70 Se così fosse, in voi fora distrutto 71 libero arbitrio, e non fora giustizia 72 per ben letizia, e per male aver lutto.
query.error: **English:** 70 If this were so, free will would be destroyed in you, 71 and there would be no justice 72 for joy in good and sorrow in evil.
query.result: 70 Gif hit swa wære, on eow wäre forloren 71 freo wille, and nære nan gerihte 72 for welan wynne, and for yfele wop.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
73 Lo cielo i vostri movimenti inizia; 74 non dico tutti, ma, posto ch’i’ ’l dica, 75 lume v’è dato a bene e a malizia,
query.error: **English:** 73 Heaven initiates your movements; 74 I do not say all, but, even if I did say it, 75 light is given to you for good and for evil,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
76 e libero voler; che, se fatica 77 ne le prime battaglie col ciel dura, 78 poi vince tutto, se ben si notrica.
query.error: **English:** 76 and free will; which, if it struggles 77 in the first battles with heaven, 78 then conquers all, if it is well nourished.
query.result: 76 and freoh wille; ðe, gif hit ðolið 77 on ðam forman gefeohte wið heofon, 78 ðonne oferswiðeð hit eall, gif hit wel geðeoh.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
79 A maggior forza e a miglior natura 80 liberi soggiacete; e quella cria 81 la mente in voi, che ’l ciel non ha in sua cura.
query.error: **English:** 79 To greater force and to a better nature 80 you are subject freely; and that creates 81 the mind in you, which heaven does not have in its care.
query.result: 79 To maran mihte and to selran gecynde 80 freolic underþeodde; and seo gesceop 81 ðone mod on eow, ðone se heofon næfð on his gewealde.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
82 Però, se ’l mondo presente disvia, 83 in voi è la cagione, in voi si cheggia; 84 e io te ne sarò or vera spia.
query.error: **English:** 82 Therefore, if the present world goes astray, 83 the cause is in you, in you it should be sought; 84 and I will now be a true guide for you in this.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
85 Esce di mano a lui che la vagheggia 86 prima che sia, a guisa di fanciulla 87 che piangendo e ridendo pargoleggia,
query.error: **English:** 85 It escapes from the hands of him who courts it, 86 before it exists, like a young girl 87 who plays, weeping and laughing.
query.result: 85 Hit gæð of ðære hand ðæs ðe hit lufað 86 ær hit sie, swilce mægden 87 ðe wepende and hlihhende plegað,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
88 l’anima semplicetta che sa nulla, 89 salvo che, mossa da lieto fattore, 90 volontier torna a ciò che la trastulla.
query.error: **English:** 88 The simple soul that knows nothing, 89 except that, moved by a joyful creator, 90 willingly returns to that which delights it.
query.result: 88 ðæt anfealde mod ðe nænig ðing nat, 89 buton ðæt hit, of fægeran wyrhta afyrht, 90 gewilnunga gæð ðær hit wyn gewæged.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
91 Di picciol bene in pria sente sapore; 92 quivi s’inganna, e dietro ad esso corre, 93 se guida o fren non torce suo amore.
query.error: **English:** 91 From a little good at first he feels pleasure; 92 there he deceives himself, and after it his love runs, 93 if his love does not turn aside its guide or rein.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
94 Onde convenne legge per fren porre; 95 convenne rege aver, che discernesse 96 de la vera cittade almen la torre.
query.error: **English:** 94 Therefore it was necessary to impose a law by force; 95 it was necessary to have a king who could discern 96 at least the tower of the true city.
query.result: 94 Þær wæs ðearf ðætte man gesette 95 cyning ofer ðe folce, ðe ða ceastre 96 geheolde wið ðone here.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
97 Le leggi son, ma chi pon mano ad esse? 98 Nullo, però che ’l pastor che procede, 99 rugumar può, ma non ha l’unghie fesse;
query.error: **English:** 97 The laws exist, but who enforces them? 98 No one, because the shepherd who leads the flock 99 can chew the cud, but his hooves are not cloven;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
100 per che la gente, che sua guida vede 101 pur a quel ben fedire ond’ ella è ghiotta, 102 di quel si pasce, e più oltre non chiede.
query.error: **English:** 100 therefore the people, who see their leader 101 intent only on devouring the good things he craves, 102 feed on those things themselves and ask for nothing more.
query.result: 100 for ði ðe folc, ðe ðone heretogan geseoð 101 ðurh ða gitsunge ða god ðe he gielpeð, 102 ðæra hi brucað and furðor ne secað.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
103 Ben puoi veder che la mala condotta 104 è la cagion che ’l mondo ha fatto reo, 105 e non natura che ’n voi sia corrotta.
query.error: **English:** 103 You can clearly see that evil conduct 104 is the reason why the world has become wicked, 105 and not nature, which is not corrupted in you.
query.result: 103 Þu miht ðone gesion ðæt yfel gewuna 104 is ðæs weorold yrmða frumsceaft, 105 and na ðin gecynd þe on ðe forloren wæs.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
106 Soleva Roma, che ’l buon mondo feo, 107 due soli aver, che l’una e l’altra strada 108 facean vedere, e del mondo e di Deo.
query.error: **English:** 106 Rome, which made the good world, 107 used to have two suns, 108 which showed both the one and the other way,
query.result: 106 Roma, ðe ðone godan world geworhte, 107 hæfde ða twegen sunnan, ða ðone weg 108 ægðer getæhton, ðæs worldríces and ðæs Godes.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
109 L’un l’altro ha spento; ed è giunta la spada 110 col pasturale, e l’un con l’altro insieme 111 per viva forza mal convien che vada;
query.error: **English:** 109 One has extinguished the other; and the sword 110 has joined with the shepherd’s staff, and one with the other 111 by main force must go ill together;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
112 però che, giunti, l’un l’altro non teme: 113 se non mi credi, pon mente a la spiga, 114 ch’ogn’ erba si conosce per lo seme.
query.error: **English:** 112 because, once joined, one does not fear the other: 113 if you do not believe me, look at the ear of corn, 114 for every plant is known by its seed.
query.result: 112 forðæm ðe ða ða hi togædere becumað, ðonne ne ondrædað se oðer ðone oðerne: 113 gif ðu me ne gelyfst, beheald ða ear, 114 forðæm ðe ælc wyrt bið oncnawen be ðæm sæde.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
115 In sul paese ch’Adice e Po riga, 116 solea valore e cortesia trovarsi, 117 prima che Federigo avesse briga;
query.error: **English:** 115 In the land where Adige and Po flow, 116 valor and courtesy used to be found, 117 before Frederick had any trouble;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
118 or può sicuramente indi passarsi 119 per qualunque lasciasse, per vergogna 120 di ragionar coi buoni o d’appressarsi.
query.error: **English:** 118 now one can safely pass through it 119 without anyone being ashamed 120 to speak with good men or to approach them.
query.result: 118 nu mæg man sikerlice ðær ðurh faran 119 for æghwylcum ðe læte, for sceome 120 ðæt he spræce wið ða godan oððe genealæce.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
121 Ben v’èn tre vecchi ancora in cui rampogna 122 l’antica età la nova, e par lor tardo 123 che Dio a miglior vita li ripogna:
query.error: **English:** 121 There were still three old men there whom the new age 122 reproaches for their old age, and it seems to them slow 123 that God should restore them to a better life:
query.result: 121 Þær wæron ða git ðreo ealde men ða ðe ða niwan yld 122 ða ealdan wrixleð, and him ðynceð ðæt to langsum 123 ðæt God him to beteran life gewende:

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
124 Currado da Palazzo e ’l buon Gherardo 125 e Guido da Castel, che mei si noma, 126 francescamente, il semplice Lombardo.
query.error: **English:** 124 Currado da Palazzo and the good Gherardo 125 and Guido da Castel, who is better known to me, 126 in the French manner, as the simple Lombard.
query.result: 124 Currado of Palazzo and ða godan Gherardo 125 and Guido of Castel, ðe me beteran is cuð, 126 on ðære Frenciscan wisan, ðone ancene Lombard.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
127 Dì oggimai che la Chiesa di Roma, 128 per confondere in sé due reggimenti, 129 cade nel fango, e sé brutta e la soma».
query.error: **English:** 127 Say now that the Church of Rome, 128 in order to confound in itself two governments, 129 fell into the mire, and befouled itself and its burden.
query.result: 127 Secge nu ðæt ðære Romaniscan gelaðunge, 128 ðurh ðæt heo wolde on hire gemengan twa gerecenysse, 129 gefeoll on ðone fenn, and afylde hire and hire byrðene.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
130 «O Marco mio», diss’ io, «bene argomenti; 131 e or discerno perché dal retaggio 132 li figli di Levì furono essenti.
query.error: **English:** 130 "O my Mark," said I, "you reason well; 131 and now I discern why from the heritage 132 the sons of Levi were exempt."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
133 Ma qual Gherardo è quel che tu per saggio 134 di’ ch’è rimaso de la gente spenta, 135 in rimprovèro del secol selvaggio?».
query.error: **English:** 133 But what Gherardo is that whom you, as wise, 134 say has remained of the extinct people, 135 in reproof of the savage age?"
query.result: 133 Ac hwilc is se Gearard ðe ðu for ðone gleawne 134 secge ðæt he wunað ðara wera forðfarendra, 135 on edwite ðisses wyrrestan lifes?"

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
136 «O tuo parlar m’inganna, o el mi tenta», 137 rispuose a me; «ché, parlandomi tosco, 138 par che del buon Gherardo nulla senta.
query.error: **English:** 136 "Either your speech deceives me, or it tempts me," 137 he replied to me; "because, speaking Tuscan to me, 138 it seems that you know nothing of the good Gherardo.
query.result: 136 "Oððe ðin spec mæneð, oððe hit mæneð me," 137 andswarode he me; "forðæm ðe ðu sprecende Tusce, 138 ðinceð ðæt ðu næfre ne gehyrde be ðæm godan Gherarde.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
139 Per altro sopranome io nol conosco, 140 s’io nol togliessi da sua figlia Gaia. 141 Dio sia con voi, ché più non vegno vosco.
query.error: **English:** 139 By any other surname I do not know him, 140 unless I were to take it from his daughter Gaia. 141 God be with you, for I come with you no more.
query.result: 139 Þurh oðerne naman ic hine ne can, 140 būtan ic hine tæce of his dehter Gēan. 141 God sīe mid ēow, forðam ic ne cume mid ēow furðor.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
142 Vedi l’albor che per lo fummo raia 143 già biancheggiare, e me convien partirmi 144 (l’angelo è ivi) prima ch’io li paia».
query.error: **English:** 142 See the dawn that breaks through the smoke, 143 already turning white, and I must leave 144 (the angel is there) before I appear to him.
query.result: 142 Loca ðone dagred ðe ðurh ðone smoca scineð 143 ða hwítende, and mec gebyreð þæt ic heonon gewende 144 (se engel is þær) ær ic him ætýwe.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
145 Così tornò, e più non volle udirmi.
query.error: **English:** 145 Thus he returned, and would not listen to me any more.
query.result: 145 Swa he gewende, and na leng wold me gehiran.
